end.title: A Brief history of time
end.creator_credit: Errol Morris, David Hickman, Anglia Television and Gordon Freedman
end.brief_description: A biography of brilliant physicist Professor Stephen Hawking who has expanded and re-evaluated our knowledge of science despite having ALS - Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis since the age of 21. An inspirational film exploring the infinite possibilities of the human mind in extending the boundaries of knowledge in regard to why we and the universe exist. The bold use of graphics and striking imagery address theories surrounding an expanding universe, the creation, black holes and past, present and future.

links.description: While Sagan was a beloved interpreter of astrophysics, another scientist is credited with exploring and popularising black holes – Stephen Hawking. Errol Morris turned Hawking’s 1988 bestseller into a documentary of the same name.

end.title: First still of Black Hole
end.brief_description: The Event Horizon Telescope—a planet-scale array of ground-based radio telescopes—has obtained the first image of a supermassive black hole and its shadow. The image, taken in 2019, reveals the central black hole of Messier 87, a massive galaxy in the Virgo cluster.
